DOCNAME: CASE OF BÖKE AND KANDEMIR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Remainder inadmissible;No violation of Art. 3 (substantive aspect);Violation of Art. 3 (procedural aspect);Violation of Art. 5-3;Violation of Art. 6-3-c;Non-pecuniary damage - award
JUDGES: András Sajó;Françoise Tulkens;Ireneu Cabral Barreto;Nona Tsotsoria;Vladimiro Zagrebelsky
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL persons were shot and injured in a bus by a person who subsequently got off the bus .

CARDINAL . On DATE , upon receipt of information that the suspect of the shooting was in a red car , police officers from the GPE police headquarters arrested the applicants during a traffic control operation that had they initiated on the ORG motorway . The security forces further arrested CARDINAL other persons , including the first applicant ’s brother , in another car . The police officers confiscated the applicants’ mobile telephones and both cars , in which CARDINAL firearms were found . On DATE , the applicants were taken into police custody .
CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL police officers drafted a report containing the numbers dialled and calls received on the mobile telephones of the first applicant , his brother and another suspect .
CARDINAL . On DATE a single judge at the ORG extended the period of the applicants’ detention in police custody for a further DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants’ statements were taken by police officers from the organised crime unit of ORG . According to the document containing their statements , the applicants were suspected of forming a criminal profit - making organisation proscribed by LAW no . CARDINAL . According to the document , both applicants confessed to their involvement in a criminal organisation .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE and DATE , the applicants were examined by doctors at ORG . The doctors noted in their reports that there were no signs of ill - treatment on the applicants’ persons .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants were brought before a single judge at the Aydın ORG , who ordered their detention on remand . Before the judge , the applicants refuted the accuracy of the documents containing their statements taken by the police .

CARDINAL . NORP On DATE the firearms found in the cars were subjected to a ballistic examination . The experts found that CARDINAL of the weapons found in the car of the first applicant ’s brother had been used in the shooting of DATE .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date a test was conducted in order to detect traces of gunpowder on the ORG and other PERSON hands , which resulted in the finding of gunpowder traces on the applicants’ hands .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG at ORG filed a bill of indictment , charging the applicants and CARDINAL other persons with forming a criminal profit - making organisation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants made statements before ORG and refuted the veracity of the documents containing their statements taken by the police . TIME containing their statements were then sent to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG held the first hearing on the merits of the case and heard some of the accused and read out the evidence in the case file . On DATE the ORG representative stated before the court that the applicants disputed the accuracy of the evidence against them , including the medical reports issued following their detention in police custody , which stated that there was no sign of physical violence on their bodies .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the court held the second and third hearings and took statements from some of the other accused .
CARDINAL . On DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE , ORG refused to release the applicants , relying on the seriousness of the offence and the evidence in the case file .

CARDINAL . On DATE , during the fourth hearing before ORG , the first applicant , PERSON , complained that he had been subjected to torture during his detention in police custody and that he suffered from cervical disk syndrome as a result . He denounced the statements that had been taken from him in police custody and contested the accuracy of the medical reports issued in his respect . At the end of the hearing , the court refused to release the applicants , taking into account the nature of the offence and state of the evidence . The court held that the next hearing would be held on DATE .
CARDINAL . The applicants filed an objection to the decision for their continued detention .
CARDINAL . On DATE another Chamber of the İzmir State Security Court dismissed the applicants’ objection , holding that the decision for their continued detention was justified .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE the ORG held CARDINAL more hearings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicants of forming a profit - making criminal gang and sentenced them to DATE and CARDINAL months’ imprisonment . In its judgment , the court took into consideration as evidence the arrest report , the report stating that firearms were found in the applicants’ car , the ORG statements to the police , the medical reports issued at the end of their detention in police custody , the report containing the details of the telephone calls made by the first applicant , the results of the test showing gunpowder traces on the applicants’ hands and the ballistic reports . The court further noted the past relations between the applicants and the other accused , as well as the hostility between them and CARDINAL of the persons who had been shot on DATE . In the light of the evidence in the case file , ORG found it established that the applicants had formed a criminal organisation with a view to making a profit , and that the shooting of the CARDINAL persons on DATE had been a result of the activities of that organisation . Taking into account the total period of the applicants’ pre - trial detention , the court ordered their release .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG filed a bill of indictment with ORG , charging the applicants with causing grievously bodily harm to third persons .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acquitted the applicants . The court noted that the persons who had been shot could not identify the applicants as the perpetrators of the shooting . It held that there was insufficient evidence in the case file to conclude that the applicants had been involved in the shooting .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant met his representative in the ORG prison . The applicant complained about the ill - treatment he had allegedly suffered in police custody . He asked his representative to secure him a medical examination .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant ’s representative filed a petition with ORG office , requesting the latter to order the medical examination of both applicants . He alleged that , during the applicants’ detention in police custody , they had been subjected to various forms of ill - treatment , including hanging by the arms , which still caused them pain and had left marks on their bodies . He further stated that the applicants had previously been examined by doctors who had turned a blind eye to these marks and had failed to draft accurate medical reports . He warned that an immediate medical examination was necessary since the traces of ill - treatment risked disappearing .

CARDINAL . On DATE , ORG sent a letter to ORG , requesting the latter to send the applicants to ORG ORG for medical examinations . He further asked the prison administration to provide him with the medical reports concerning the findings on the ORG bodies so that he could verify whether they had been subjected to ill - treatment .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was taken to a clinic attached to the ORG Governor ’s office . A doctor examined the applicant and drafted a report in which he noted that there was no sign of ill - treatment . He recommended that the applicant undergo a medical examination by a neurologist .
CARDINAL . On DATE a doctor at ORG drafted a report on the first applicant ’s neurological examination . He noted that there were no pathological findings in respect of the applicant .

CARDINAL . According to the first applicant ’s submissions , on DATE , another doctor at the hospital took an x - ray of his neck . The applicant further submitted that the doctor had noted in his report that he was suffering from cervical disk syndrome . The doctor sent the applicant ’s x - ray to the ORG prison .

CARDINAL . On DATE a doctor at ORG prescribed a hard cervical collar for the first applicant . According to TIME of the hearing before ORG held on DATE , the applicant appeared before the court wearing the collar .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with ORG office against the police officers who had allegedly illtreated him , and the prison authorities , who had failed to arrange his transportation to a hospital for medical examination . He also complained about the doctors who had not examined him in accordance with the regulations and had failed to note his injuries in their reports .
CARDINAL . On DATE a doctor prescribed anti - inflammatory medicine ( GPE ) for the applicant .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant stated before ORG , within the context of his defence concerning the case brought against him before ORG ( see paragraph CARDINAL above ) , that he had been subjected to torture and had suffered from severe pain in his neck as a result . He further maintained that he could not receive appropriate medical treatment since he was detained .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision to discontinue the criminal proceedings against the police officers since no sign of ill - treatment had been detected on the applicant ’s person . In his decision , the public prosecutor relied exclusively on the medical reports issued in respect of the applicant on CARDINAL , DATE and DATE and the medical report issued during the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON filed an objection with ORG against this decision . He maintained that he had worn a cervical collar for DATE . He further contended that the cervical X - ray , the medical report diagnosing him with cervical disk syndrome and the prescriptions had not been given to him . Nor had they been included in the investigation file .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s objection . The court considered that the decision to discontinue the proceedings was justified given the lack of sufficient evidence capable of substantiating the applicant ’s allegations of ill - treatment .
